oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Bushman doings and prayers when Canopus and his grandmother Sirius come out (L II.-37. 3348-3355). An address or prayer to the stars Canopus and Sirius. 1) p.3348v: the sun is only a little warm when Canopus appears in winter, 2) p.3350v: Canopus (|ko a-ggu) and Sirius (!kuttau) are both female stars, 3) p.3354v: the people leave one arm out of their karosses when in the sun, 4) See also Names for the star Canopus, 5) This story is found in Book II-37.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Lucy Lloyd |xam notebooks
oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Address or prayer to the star Canopus and the star Sirius
